title: Red Sox CBO Craig Breslow reportedly prioritizing finding a GM this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Craig Breslow is searching for a general manager to assist in Red Sox baseball operations for the 2026 season.
The Red Sox have not had a general manager since Breslow's hiring, with previous GMs having reduced roles.
Potential candidates include current Assistant GMs Raquel Ferreira, Eddie Romero, Michael Groopman, Taylor Smith, and Paul Toboni.

title: Patriots move on from Ja’Lynn Polk, reportedly trading him to Saints
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots trade wide receiver Ja'Lynn Polk to the Saints for a 2027 sixth-round pick and a 2028 seventh-round pick.
Polk, a second-round pick in 2024, had 12 receptions for 87 yards and two touchdowns last season with the Patriots.
With Polk traded, only two players from the Patriots’ 2024 draft class remain on the roster.

title: 5 things to know about Dolphins before Patriots take them on in Week 2
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Patriots have lost their last five games in Miami against the Dolphins.
Tua Tagovailoa is undefeated in seven starts against the Patriots since being drafted.
Dolphins' defensive line includes pass rushers like Bradley Chubb and Jaelan Phillips.

title: Review & setlist: Ethel Cain haunts Roadrunner with Southern Gothic epic
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Ethel Cain performed a Southern Gothic-themed concert at the Roadrunner in Boston on September 12, 2025.
The show featured songs from 'Willoughby Tucker, I’ll Always Love You' as well as a powerful encore.
Toronto band 9Million opened for Cain, energizing the crowd with a shoegaze set.

title: 45 years later, Andover High’s Chiklis returns to gridiron for ‘The Senior’
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: Michael Chiklis stars as 59-year-old Mike Flynt in 'The Senior,' a film about redemption and football.
Chiklis, an Andover High alum, returns to the field for the first time since 1980 to portray Flynt.
The film, directed by Rod Lurie, sees a Boston screening on Sept. 14, ahead of its national release on Sept. 19.

title: Here are the Mass. residents who made the new Forbes list of 400 richest Americans
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Nine Massachusetts residents feature on Forbes' list of 400 richest Americans, with net worths from $3.9 billion to $35 billion.
Abigail Johnson remains the richest person in Massachusetts, ranking 27th overall with a net worth of $35 billion.
Elon Musk tops the list with a net worth of $428 billion, followed by Mark Zuckerberg and Jeff Bezos.

title: In most anticipated series at Fenway in years, Red Sox faceplant against Yankees in opener
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Red Sox lost 4-1 to Yankees at Fenway Park, managing only two hits in the game.
Lucas Giolito pitched 5.2 innings for the Red Sox, giving up two runs against New York.
Boston's offensive struggles continued as they failed to score with runners in scoring positions and made three errors.

title: Former Patriots DE Deatrich Wise Jr. suffers season-ending injury
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Deatrich Wise Jr. suffered a season-ending left quad injury during a game against the Green Bay Packers.
Wise, 31, underwent surgery after injuring himself while trying to block an extra point in the second quarter.
Wise joined the Washington Commanders for the 2025 season after spending eight years with the New England Patriots.

title: When will Connelly Early pitch next for Red Sox? Alex Cora explains
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Connelly Early may pitch for the Red Sox against the Athletics next week at Fenway Park.
Early impressed in his MLB debut, striking out 11 batters over five scoreless innings against the A's.
Alex Cora is evaluating Boston's rotation options, including Early, Payton Tolle, and Kyle Harrison.

title: Scott Boras says he, Alex Bregman are ‘waiting until the offseason’ before making opt-out decision
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Alex Bregman and agent Scott Boras will decide on his contract opt-out after the 2025 season ends.
Bregman is on a three-year, $120 million contract with opt-outs after the 2025 and 2026 seasons.
Bregman has been influential for Boston's young players, contributing leadership on and off the field.
